test-set.name: prod-LetClause
test-set.description: Tests for the LetClause production (or the LetExpr in XPath 3.0)

source.description: Source document for Function Declaration tests

test-case.name: letexprwith-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of let clause bound to variable used in expression that raises error.

test-case.name: letexprwith-2
test-case.description: Let clause used decimal type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-3
test-case.description: Let clause using integer type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-4
test-case.description: Let clause using double type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-5
test-case.description: Let clause using double type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-6
test-case.description: Let clause using boolean (true) type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-7
test-case.description: Let clause using boolean (false) type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-8
test-case.description: Let clause using date type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-9
test-case.description: Let clause using time type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-10
test-case.description: Let clause using dateTime type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-11
test-case.description: Let clause using float type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-12
test-case.description: Let clause using an ineteger expression type.

test-case.name: letexprwith-13
test-case.description: Let clause using the fn:count function.

test-case.name: letexprwith-14
test-case.description: Let clause using the fn:not function.

test-case.name: letexprwith-15
test-case.description: Let clause using the "and" operator function.
test-case.test: let $var as xs:boolean := fn:true() and fn:true() return $var

test-case.name: letexprwith-16
test-case.description: Let clause using the "or" operator function.
test-case.test: let $var as xs:boolean := fn:true() and fn:true() return $var

test-case.name: letexprwith-17
test-case.description: Let clause using the "string-length" function.
test-case.test: let $var as xs:integer := fn:string-length("A String") return $var

test-case.name: letexprwith-18
test-case.description: Let clause using a casting from integer to string

test-case.name: letexprwith-19
test-case.description: Let clause using a casting from decimal to string

test-case.name: letexprwith-20
test-case.description: Let clause using a casting from double to string

test-case.name: letexprwith-21
test-case.description: Let clause using a casting from boolean to string

test-case.name: letexprwith-22
test-case.description: Let clause using a integer type and addition expression on return clause

test-case.name: letexprwith-23
test-case.description: Let clause using an "if" expression
test-case.test: let $var as xs:boolean := if (fn:true()) then fn:true() else fn:false() return $var

test-case.name: letexprwith-24
test-case.description: Let clause using a "typeswitch" expression
test-case.test: let $var as xs:string := typeswitch(fn:true()) case $i as xs:boolean return "Test Passed" default return "Test failed" return $var

test-case.name: LetExpr001
test-case.description: Purpose : Assign a simple string using let

test-case.name: LetExpr002
test-case.description: Purpose : Assign a simple integer using let

test-case.name: LetExpr003
test-case.description: Purpose : Use an arithmetic operator with let

test-case.name: LetExpr004
test-case.description: Purpose : Use xs:long(upper bound)

test-case.name: LetExpr005
test-case.description: Purpose : Use xs:long(lower bound) +1

test-case.name: LetExpr006
test-case.description: Purpose : Use xs:double(upper bound)

test-case.name: LetExpr007
test-case.description: Purpose : A node with an expression in curly braces

test-case.name: LetExpr008
test-case.description: Purpose : More than one variable cross referencing compatible values

test-case.name: LetExpr009
test-case.description: Purpose : More than one variable cross referencing compatible values

test-case.name: LetExpr010
test-case.description: Purpose : More than one variable cross referencing incompatible values

test-case.name: LetExpr011
test-case.description: Purpose : Use sequences with filter expressions

test-case.name: LetExpr012
test-case.description: Purpose : Use sequences with filter expressions with more than one variable
test-case.test: let $x :=(1 to 100)[. mod 5 eq 0], $y := $x[. mod 10 eq 0] return $y

test-case.name: LetExpr013
test-case.description: Purpose : Use a function in the let

test-case.name: LetExpr014
test-case.description: Purpose : Use incompatible types in let

test-case.name: LetExpr015
test-case.description: Purpose : Use a sequence of different types of scalars

test-case.name: LetExpr016
test-case.description: Purpose : Use a sequence of nodes

test-case.name: LetExpr017
test-case.description: Purpose : Use a sequence with step

test-case.name: LetExpr018
test-case.description: Purpose : Use a sequence of different values

test-case.name: LetExpr019
test-case.description: Purpose : combine two 'Let' exprs in one 'Return'

test-case.name: LetExpr020
test-case.description: Purpose : Use three variables

test-case.name: LetExpr020a
test-case.description: Purpose : Use three variables - invalid in XPath 3.0

test-case.name: LetExpr021
test-case.description: Purpose : Refer to an undefined variable

test-case.name: K-LetExprWithout-1
test-case.description: A 'let' variable is out-of-scope due to FLWOR has higher precendence than the comma operator.

test-case.name: K-LetExprWithout-2
test-case.description: A value in a 'let' variable cannot be assigned to with '=', it must be ':='.

test-case.name: K-LetExprWithout-3
test-case.description: A value in a 'let' variable cannot be assigned to with 'in', it must be ':='.

test-case.name: K-LetExprWithout-4
test-case.description: A binding in a let-expression shadows global variables.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-1
test-case.description: fn:deep-equal combined with a for/let expression.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-2
test-case.description: fn:deep-equal combined with a for/let expression(#2).

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-3
test-case.description: The focus is undefined inside the initializing expression for a 'let' variable.
test-case.test: declare function local:myFunc() { let $v := . return $v }; local:myFunc()

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-4
test-case.description: The focus is undefined inside the initializing expression for a 'let' variable(#2).
test-case.test: declare function local:myFunc($arg as node()) { let $v := . return $arg/$v }; local:myFunc(<e/>)

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-5
test-case.description: The focus is undefined inside the initializing expression for a 'let' variable(#3).
test-case.test: declare function local:myFunc($arg as node()) { let $v := aNameTest return $arg/$v }; local:myFunc(<e/>)

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-6
test-case.description: The focus is undefined inside the initializing expression for a 'let' variable(#4).
test-case.test: declare function local:myFunc($arg as node()) { let $v := aNameTest return $arg/$v }; 1

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-7
test-case.description: let-declarations doesn't cause type conversion.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-8
test-case.description: A single return statement is syntactically incorrect.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-9
test-case.description: let-declarations doesn't cause numeric promotion.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-10
test-case.description: let-declarations doesn't cause numeric promotion(#2).

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-11
test-case.description: let-declarations doesn't cause numeric promotion(#3).

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-12
test-case.description: let-declarations doesn't cause numeric promotion(#4).

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-13
test-case.description: let-declarations doesn't cause numeric promotion(#5).

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-14
test-case.description: let-declarations doesn't cause string promotion conversion.
test-case.test: let $i as xs:string := xs:untypedAtomic("a string") return $i

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-15
test-case.description: let-declarations doesn't cause URI promotion conversion.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-16
test-case.description: Ensure node identity is properly handled through a for binding.
test-case.test: declare variable $e := <e/>; for $i in (<a/>, $e, <c/>) return $i is $e

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-17
test-case.description: Ensure a name test is reported for using the undefined focus, when appearing as a child of a let binding. However, since the let body is the empty sequence, it does not have to be evaluated.
test-case.test: declare function local:function() { let $b := (i/a) return () }; empty(local:function())

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-18
test-case.description: Use a let-variable that acts as an alias for a function argument.
test-case.test: declare function local:foo($a as xs:integer) { if($a = 3) then $a else let $a := $a return local:foo($a + 1) }; local:foo(1)

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-19
test-case.description: Use an undefined focus in a let binding.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-20
test-case.description: Bind to let and subsequently use the for expression.
test-case.test: let $emps := //employee[location = "Denver"] for $d in distinct-values($emps/deptno) let $e := $emps[deptno = $d] return <dept> <deptno>{$d}</deptno> <headcount> {count($e)} </headcount> <payroll> {sum($e/salary)} </payroll> </dept>

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-21
test-case.description: Use a focus within a LET tail expression.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-22
test-case.description: Use a focus within a LET expression.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-23
test-case.description: Bind the context item to a variable.

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-24
test-case.description: Ensure a name test is reported for using the undefined focus, when appearing as a child of a let binding.
test-case.test: declare function local:function() { let $b := (i/a) return 1 }; local:function()

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-25
test-case.description: A combination of expressions that triggers a bug in some parsers.
test-case.test: let $a := 1 return for $b in 1 return if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else if ($b) then 1 else ()

test-case.name: K2-LetExprWithout-26
test-case.description: An element() test whose cardinality doesn't match.

test-case.name: xquery10keywords
test-case.description: Purpose : keywords can be used as variable names
test-case.test: let $ancestor-or-self := 1 let $ancestor := 1 let $and := 1 let $as := 1 let $ascending := 1 let $at := 1 let $attribute := 1 let $base-uri := 1 let $boundary-space := 1 let $by := 1 let $case := 1 let $cast := 1 let $castable := 1 let $child := 1 let $collation := 1 let $comment := 1 let $construction := 1 let $copy-namespaces := 1 let $declare := 1 let $default := 1 let $descendant-or-self := 1 let $descendant := 1 let $descending := 1 let $div := 1 let $document-node := 1 let $document := 1 let $element := 1 let $else := 1 let $empty-sequence := 1 let $empty := 1 let $encoding := 1 let $eq := 1 let $every := 1 let $except := 1 let $external := 1 let $following-sibling := 1 let $following := 1 let $for := 1 let $function := 1 let $ge := 1 let $greatest := 1 let $gt := 1 let $idiv := 1 let $if := 1 let $import := 1 let $in := 1 let $inherit := 1 let $instance := 1 let $intersect := 1 let $is := 1 let $item := 1 let $lax := 1 let $le := 1 let $least := 1 let $let := 1 let $lt := 1 let $mod := 1 let $module := 1 let $module := 1 let $namespace := 1 let $ne := 1 let $no-inherit := 1 let $no-preserve := 1 let $node := 1 let $of := 1 let $option := 1 let $or := 1 let $order := 1 let $ordered := 1 let $ordering := 1 let $parent := 1 let $preceding-sibling := 1 let $preceding := 1 let $preserve := 1 let $processing-instruction := 1 let $return := 1 let $satisfies := 1 let $schema-attribute := 1 let $schema-element := 1 let $schema := 1 let $self := 1 let $some := 1 let $stable := 1 let $strict := 1 let $strip := 1 let $text := 1 let $then := 1 let $to := 1 let $treat := 1 let $typeswitch := 1 let $union := 1 let $unordered := 1 let $validate := 1 let $variable := 1 let $version := 1 let $where := 1 let $xquery := 1 return 2

test-case.description: Purpose : keywords can be used as element name tests

test-case.name: xquery10keywords3
test-case.description: Purpose : keywords can be used as element names

test-case.name: xquery30keywords
test-case.description: Purpose : keywords can be used as variable names

test-case.test: let $NaN := 1 let $allowing := 1 let $ancestor-or-self := 1 let $ancestor := 1 let $and := 1 let $as := 1 let $ascending := 1 let $at := 1 let $attribute := 1 let $base-uri := 1 let $boundary-space := 1 let $by := 1 let $case := 1 let $cast := 1 let $castable := 1 let $catch := 1 let $child := 1 let $collation := 1 let $comment := 1 let $construction := 1 let $context := 1 let := 1 let $gt := 1 let $idiv := 1 let $if := 1 let $import := 1 let $in := 1 let $infinity := 1 let $inherit := 1 let $instance := 1 let $intersect := 1 let $is := 1 let $item := 1 let $lax := 1 let $le := 1 let $least := 1 let $let := 1 let $lt := 1 let $minus-sign := 1 let $mod := 1 let $module := 1 let $namespace-node := 1 let $namespace := 1 let $ne := 1 let $next := 1 let $no-inherit := 1
